name: ListActivityLogEntries
description:
Fetch a list of activity log entries.

This tool retrieves a list of activity log entries from Calendly, requiring an Enterprise subscription. It is useful for accessing detailed logs of various activities.

parameters.name: organization_uri
parameters.description: URI of the organization to filter activity log entries.

value_schema.description: Return activity log entries from the organization associated with this URI

parameters.name: filter_by_search_term
parameters.description: Filters entries using supported operators: `|`, `+`, `"`, `-`, `()`, `*`. For example, `this | that` or `(email) + (signup)`.

value_schema.description:
Filters entries based on the search term.

Supported operators:
  - `|` - to allow filtering by one term or another. Example: `this | that`
  - `+` - to allow filtering by one term and another. Example: `this + that`
  - `"` - to allow filtering by an exact search term. Example: `"email@website.com"`
  - `-` - to omit specific terms from results. Example: `Added -User`
  - `()` - to allow specifying precedence during a search. Example: `(this + that) OR (person + place)`
  - `*` - to allow prefix searching. Example `*@other-website.com`

parameters.name: user_associated_uris
parameters.description: Return entries from the user(s) associated with the provided URIs. This should be an array of strings representing the URIs of users.

value_schema.description: Return entries from the user(s) associated with the provided URIs

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specify the field and direction to sort results. Use format {field}:{direction}.

value_schema.description: Order results by the specified field and direction. List of {field}:{direction} values.

parameters.name: include_entries_after
parameters.description: Include entries that occurred after this time. Use format: "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ" (UTC).

value_schema.description: Include entries that occurred after this time (sample time format: "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678Z"). This time should use the UTC timezone.

parameters.name: max_occurred_at_time
parameters.description: Include entries that occurred prior to this UTC time in the format "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.SSSZ".

value_schema.description: Include entries that occurred prior to this time (sample time format: "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678Z"). This time should use the UTC timezone.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token to get the next portion of the activity log collection.

value_schema.description: The token to pass to get the next portion of the collection

parameters.name: number_of_rows_to_return
parameters.description: Specifies the number of activity log entries to return in the response.

value_schema.description: The number of rows to return

parameters.name: entry_categories
parameters.description: Specify the categories of log entries to filter the results. This is an array of strings, each representing a category.

value_schema.description: The categories of the entries

parameters.name: actions
parameters.description: Specify one or more actions associated with the log entries. Accepts an array of strings.

value_schema.description: The action(s) associated with the entries

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the calendly API.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: Return activity log entries from the organization associated with this URI

value_schema.description: Return activity log entries from the organization associated with this URI

parameters.description:
Filters entries based on the search term.

Supported operators:
  - `|` - to allow filtering by one term or another. Example: `this | that`
  - `+` - to allow filtering by one term and another. Example: `this + that`
  - `"` - to allow filtering by an exact search term. Example: `"email@website.com"`
  - `-` - to omit specific terms from results. Example: `Added -User`
  - `()` - to allow specifying precedence during a search. Example: `(this + that) OR (person + place)`
  - `*` - to allow prefix searching. Example `*@other-website.com`

value_schema.description:
Filters entries based on the search term.

Supported operators:

  - `+` - to allow filtering by one term and another. Example: `this + that`
  - `"` - to allow filtering by an exact search term. Example: `"email@website.com"`
  - `-` - to omit specific terms from results. Example: `Added -User`
  - `()` - to allow specifying precedence during a search. Example: `(this + that) OR (person + place)`
  - `*` - to allow prefix searching. Example `*@other-website.com`

value_schema.description: Return entries from the user(s) associated with the provided URIs

parameters.description: Include entries that occurred after this time (sample time format: "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678Z"). This time should use the UTC timezone.
